questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

Your company has two offices in Canada and Australia.

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

A user named User1 moves from the Canada office to the Australia office.

You need to use PowerShell to move data at rest to Australia for User1.

How should you complete the PowerShell command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

You have a team named Project1.

You need to deploy a compliance solution for Project1. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Detect conversations between project users that might relate to insider trading.
• Monitor for exfiltration activities, and then send alerts.

What should you use for each requirement? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: I would say: a. communication compliance https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/communication-compliance-teams#:~:text=Microsoft%20Teams%20and%20Microsoft%20Purview%20Communication%20Compliance and Insider Risk https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/insider-risk-management-activities#:~:text=Investigate%20insider%20risk%20management%20activities
I would say: a. communication compliance
I believe the correct answer for the first box is communication compliance: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/communication-compliance

You create a group naming policy to enforce a consistent naming convention for Teams names.

Which users are exempt from the group naming policy restrictions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Key Word - "its own Microsoft Entra ID instance"
The multitenant organization scenario occurs when an organization has more than one tenant instance of Microsoft Entra ID.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/multi-tenant-organizations/overview

Selected Answer: B
Key Word - "its own Microsoft Entra ID instance"
The multitenant organization scenario occurs when an organization has more than one tenant instance of Microsoft Entra ID.

questions.question_text:
Your company has three divisions. Each division has a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and its own Microsoft Entra ID instance. All the divisions use Teams for collaboration and communication.

You need to recommend a seamless collaboration solution between all the divisions. The solution must support the following:

• Search for users
• Free/busy status for Teams meetings
• Collaboration on files stored in Teams

What should you include in the recommendation?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You need to prevent a user named User1 from permanently deleting private chats in Microsoft Teams.
Solution: You create an In-Place Hold for the Microsoft SharePoint site used by Microsoft Teams.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Chats are not stored on SharePoint. It is stored either on the personal mailbox or group mailbox. Only files are stored into OneDrive\Sharepoint depending on whether it is private or group\channel chats.
https://global-sharepoint.com/sharepoint-online/office-365-where-does-the-microsoft-teams-channel-conversations-and-files-get-saved/

Q7 is about keeping user Mailbox in Litigation Hold (All Priv chats are specific to user mailbox)
Q8 - It says SP site in Hold which is incorrect

Selected Answer: B
Chat > Mailbox,
Files > Sharepoint

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B

I think the main point in this question, is "Prevent the user from deleting the chat..."
A litigation hold will back up the info, thus preventing it from being deleted, but there is a much better method to prevent the user from deleting the chat in the first place:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/messaging-policies-in-teams
If I see this on the exam, I am going to select NO.
Private chats are in the user mailbox, channel chats are in the group mailbox, private channel chats are also in the user mailbox.

Q7 - private chats are stored in user mailboxes
Q8 - documents and personal + shared data is stored in Sharepoint

comments.content: private chats in user mailbox, public in teams resource mailbox

discussion.content: Chats are saved in the mailbox, not on share point
Difference between Q7 and Q8 any one? they seem to be the same but different answers
